This method always returns NO, since buffering configuration is ignored

closeFile
This method closes and releases the underlying file handle.

activateOptions

( void ) activateOptions;

Activate the options that were previously set with calls to option setters.

This allows to defer activiation of the options until all options have been set. This is required for objects which have related options that remain ambigous until all are set.

For example, the L4FileAppender has the fileName and append options both of which are ambigous until the other is also set. So if you call setFileName: or setAppend: in your code, you have to call this method to have your changes take effect.

append

Returns the append option of this object. 
( BOOL ) append;
method result
YES = output will be appended to the end of the file, NO = output will overwrite the previous contents of the file

bufferSize

This method always returns 0, since buffering configuration is ignored 
( int ) bufferSize;
method result
This method always returns 0

bufferedIO

This method always returns NO, since buffering configuration is ignored 
( BOOL ) bufferedIO;
method result
This method always returns NO

closeFile

This method closes and releases the underlying file handle. 
( void ) closeFile;

fileName

Returns the path to the file to which log output should be written. 
( NSString *) fileName;
method result
The path to the file to which log output should be written.

init

A basic initializer. 
( id ) init;

This method calls initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize: with layout and file name set to nil, append is NO, bufferIO is NO, bufferSize is 0

method result
An initialized L4FileAppender object

initWithLayout

Initializes an L4FileAppender instance with the specified layout and file path name.
See Also:
initWithLayout:fileName:
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout
    fileName :
        (NSString *) aName;
// throws IOException

This method calls initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize: with the specified layout and file name, append is NO, bufferIO is NO, bufferSize is 0

initWithLayout

Initializes an L4FileAppender instance with the specified layout, file path name, append option, and buffering options.
See Also:
initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize:
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout
    fileName :
        (NSString *) aName
    append :
        (BOOL ) append
    bufferIO :
        (BOOL ) bufferedIO
    bufferSize :
        (int ) buffereSize;
// throws IOException

This is the class's designated initializer. The bufferIO and bufferSize arguments are ignored.

initWithLayout

Initializes an L4FileAppender instance with the specified layout, file path name, and append option.
See Also:
initWithLayout:fileName:append:
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout
    fileName :
        (NSString *) aName
    append :
        (BOOL ) append;
// throws IOException

This method calls initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize: with the specified layout, file name, and append option, bufferIO is NO, bufferSize is 0

initWithLayout:fileName:

Initializes an L4FileAppender instance with the specified layout and file path name.
See Also:
initWithLayout
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout
    fileName :
        (NSString *) aName;
// throws IOException

This method calls initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize: with the specified layout and file name, append is NO, bufferIO is NO, bufferSize is 0

Parameter Descriptions
aLayout
The layout that this appender should use
aName
The file path of the file you want log output to be written to. If the file does not exist, it will be created if possible. If the file cannot be created for some reason, a FileNotFoundException will be raised.
method result
An initialized L4FileAppender object

initWithLayout:fileName:append:

Initializes an L4FileAppender instance with the specified layout, file path name, and append option.
See Also:
initWithLayout
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout
    fileName :
        (NSString *) aName
    append :
        (BOOL ) append;
// throws IOException

This method calls initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize: with the specified layout, file name, and append option, bufferIO is NO, bufferSize is 0

Parameter Descriptions
aLayout
The layout that this appender should use
aName
The file path of the file you want log output to be written to. If the file does not exist, it will be created if possible. If the file cannot be created for some reason, a FileNotFoundException will be raised.
append
YES = log output should be appended to the file. NO = the file's previous contents should be overwritten
method result
An initialized L4FileAppender object

initWithLayout:fileName:append:bufferIO:bufferSize:

Initializes an L4FileAppender instance with the specified layout, file path name, append option, and buffering options.
See Also:
initWithLayout
( id ) initWithLayout:
        (L4Layout *) aLayout
    fileName :
        (NSString *) aName
    append :
        (BOOL ) append
    bufferIO :
        (BOOL ) bufferedIO
    bufferSize :
        (int ) buffereSize;
// throws IOException

This is the class's designated initializer. The bufferIO and bufferSize arguments are ignored.

Parameter Descriptions
aLayout
The layout that this appender should use
aName
The file path of the file you want log output to be written to. If the file does not exist, it will be created if possible. If the file cannot be created for some reason, a FileNotFoundException will be raised.
append
YES = log output should be appended to the file. NO = the file's previous contents should be overwritten.
bufferedIO
This argument is ignored.
bufferSize
This argument is ignored.
method result
An initialized L4FileAppender object

setAppend

Sets the append option for this object
See Also:
setAppend:
( void ) setAppend:
        (BOOL ) append;

If you use this method, make sure you call activateOptions to have it take effect.

setAppend:

Sets the append option for this object
See Also:
setAppend
( void ) setAppend:
        (BOOL ) append;

If you use this method, make sure you call activateOptions to have it take effect.

Parameter Descriptions
append
YES = append output to the end of the file, NO = overwrite the previous contents of the file when the file is opened for logging output

setBufferSize

This method does nothing.
See Also:
setBufferSize:
( void ) setBufferSize:
        (int ) size;

setBufferSize:

This method does nothing.
See Also:
setBufferSize
( void ) setBufferSize:
        (int ) size;
Parameter Descriptions
size
This argument is ignored

This method does nothing.

        (BOOL ) buffer;

setBufferedIO:

This method does nothing.

        (BOOL ) buffer;

buffer
This argument is ignored

setFile

Sets the file name and append options simultaneously.
See Also:
setFile:append:bufferedIO:bufferSize:
( void ) setFile:
        (NSString *) fileName
    append :
        (BOOL ) append
    bufferedIO :
        (BOOL ) bufferedIO
    bufferSize :
        (int ) size;
// synchronized . . . make thread safe?? throws IOException

If you use this method, make sure you call activateOptions to have it take effect.

setFile:append:bufferedIO:bufferSize:

Sets the file name and append options simultaneously.
See Also:
setFile
( void ) setFile:
        (NSString *) fileName
    append :
        (BOOL ) append
    bufferedIO :
        (BOOL ) bufferedIO
    bufferSize :
        (int ) size;
// synchronized . . . make thread safe?? throws IOException

If you use this method, make sure you call activateOptions to have it take effect.

Parameter Descriptions
fileName
The path to the file to which you want log output written
append
YES = append output to the end of the file, NO = overwrite the previous contents of the file when the file is opened for logging output
bufferedIO
This argument is ignored
bufferSize
This argument is ignored

Sets the path to the file to which you want log output written.

If you use this method, make sure you call activateOptions to have it take effect.
